description: trap generated if a notification that does not contain a template indication is received
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NEXUS-MIB::default NEXUS-MIB::description s EXAMPLE NEXUS-MIB::sourceInstanceHost s EXAMPLE NEXUS-MIB::sourceInstanceName s EXAMPLE NEXUS-MIB::sourceInstanceType s EXAMPLE

description: this is a global variable that can be reused
variables.name: NEXUS-MIB::description

description: this contains the hostname where the nexus element that generated the alarm is/was running
variables.name: NEXUS-MIB::sourceInstanceHost

description: this contains the name of nexus element that generated the alarm
variables.name: NEXUS-MIB::sourceInstanceName

description: this contains the type of nexus element that generated the alarm
variables.name: NEXUS-MIB::sourceInstanceType

description: trap sent by monit process manager signaling the change of state of one of the monitored processes

Summary.eval: ($v3 ne '') ? '$v3' : 'Monitored processes manager signaling state changed'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NEXUS-MIB::monit NEXUS-MIB::code i 9999 NEXUS-MIB::consequence s EXAMPLE NEXUS-MIB::description s EXAMPLE NEXUS-MIB::sourceInstanceHost s EXAMPLE NEXUS-MIB::sourceInstanceName s EXAMPLE NEXUS-MIB::sourceInstanceType s EXAMPLE

description: this contains the alarm severity; 0 means everything ok, clear all other alarms with same OID
